sen.j: 井上 泰助（いのうえ たいすけ、安政4年12月5日 (旧暦)（1858年1月19日）－昭和2年（1927年）2月10日）は、新選組隊士。
sen.e: Taisuke INOUE (January 19, 1858-February 10, 1927) was a member of Shinsengumi.
Taisuke INOUE (January 19, 1858-February 10, 1927) was a member of the Shinsengumi.
Taisuke INOUE (January 19, 1858-February 10, 1927) was a member of the Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 八王子千人同心の井上松五郎の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Matsugoro INOUE, a Hachioji Sennin Doshin (junior officials in Hachioji).
He was the second son of Matsugoro INOUE, a Hachioji Sennin Doshin (junior officials in Hachioji).
He was the second son of Matsugoro INOUE, a Hachioji Sennin Doshin (junior officials in Hachioji).

sen.j: 叔父は新選組六番隊長として知られる井上源三郎である。
sen.e: His uncle was Genzaburo INOUE known as the leader of Rokubangumi of Shinsengumi.
His uncle was Genzaburo INOUE known as the leader of the Rokubangumi of the Shinsengumi.
His uncle was Genzaburo INOUE known as the leader of the Rokubangumi of the Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）に11歳で新選組に入隊。
sen.e: In 1867, when he was 11 years old, he joined the Shinsengumi.
In 1867, when he was 11 years old, he joined the Shinsengumi.
In 1867, when he was 11 years old, he joined the Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 局長近藤勇の刀持ちを務めていた。
sen.e: He served as a sword bearer for Isami KONDO, the head of the Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He served as a sword bearer for Isami KONDO, the head of the Shinsengumi.
He served as a sword bearer for Isami KONDO, the head of the Shinsengumi.

sen.j: まもなく、大政奉還、王政復古の令を経て戊辰戦争が勃発し、叔父源三郎が鳥羽・伏見の戦いで戦死。
sen.e: The Boshin War broke out shortly after the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) and the Restoration of Imperial Rule, and his uncle Genzaburo died in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Boshin War broke out shortly after the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) and the Restoration of Imperial Rule, and his uncle Genzaburo died in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
The Boshin War broke out shortly after the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) and the Restoration of Imperial Rule, and his uncle Genzaburo died in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.

sen.j: 源三郎の首を持ち帰ろうとするが、重くて運ぶことができなかった。
sen.e: Taisuke tried to bring the head of Genzaburo back, but gave up because it was heavy to carry.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Taisuke tried to bring the head of Genzaburo back, but gave up because it was too heavy to carry.
Taisuke tried to bring the head of Genzaburo back, but gave up because it was too heavy to carry.

sen.j: 他の隊士に促されて近くの寺の境内に埋めたと言う。
sen.e: He was persuaded by other members of the Shinsengumi to bury the body in precincts of a temple nearby.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was persuaded by other members of the Shinsengumi to bury the body in precincts of a temple nearby.
He was persuaded by other members of the Shinsengumi to bury the body in precincts of a temple nearby.

sen.j: その後、井上家に戻って源三郎の戦死を伝えた。
sen.e: After that, he returned to the Inoue family and told the death of Genzaburo.
After that, he returned to the Inoue family and told the death of Genzaburo.
After that, he returned to the Inoue family and told the death of Genzaburo.
